alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Middlesex; New Kent; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:09AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rain will impact portions of northwestern Gloucester, southwestern Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, New Kent, southeastern Hanover and southeastern King William Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 309 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Highland Springs to near Barhamsville. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Locations impacted include... New Kent, King William, West Point, Talleysville, King And Queen Court House, Mechanicsville, Tunstall, Saluda, Glenns, Little Plymouth, Shacklefords, Barhamsville, Eltham, Harmony Village, Cohoke, Westwood, Rose Garden, Mattaponi, Colonial Downs and Palls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Middlesex; New Kent; Western King William
